Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 29 points and shot 7-for-14 from 3-point range as the Minnesota Timberwolves escaped with a 119-116 win over the Denver Nuggets on Friday night.
Rudy Gobert notched 17 points and 14 rebounds, Naz Reid scored 16 off the bench, and Jaden McDaniel contributed 10 points.
Aaron Gordon scored a game-high 31 points and grabbed 11 rebounds for Denver.
Nikola Jokic had 26 points, 13 assists and nine rebounds, and Michael Porter Jr. also logged 26 points.
Christian Braun added 14 points and made a highlight-reel play, leaping for a dunk over Gobert.
Despite Murray's absence, Denver stormed to a 25-3 run to grab a 112-102 lead with 4:17 remaining.
Both players received a technical foul after officials reviewed the play following Braun's shoulder charge on Gobert.
Post-Match Reflections: Edwards scored the go-ahead basket with a floating jump shot that put Minnesota on top 117-116 with 25.7 seconds to go.
Gobert added a pair of free throws with 10.1 seconds left to increase the lead to three.
Jokic fired a 3-point attempt from the right corner that missed in the waning seconds.
